p: According to the results shown in Table-2, dichloromethane extracts from O.F and P.B, ethanol extract from P.B, and ethyl acetate extracts of all plants were active with EC 50 <30 μg/mL. Ethyl acetate was the most active extract, which showed EC 50 values of 9.8, 14.1, 23.7, and 25.5 μg/mL, for L.S, P.B, O.F, and P.F, respectively. Hexane extract from P.B and O.F exhibited moderate activity with EC 50 values of 84.8 and 87.4 μg/mL, respectively. The activity of these extracts was probably due to the presence of compounds such as terpenoids, flavonoids, and coumarins ( Table-1), which have long been recognized for their antiprotozoal activity [ 17- 20].
